topic.title: Setting Parameters in the Command-Line Scripts

body.p: If you start with a command-line script (oxygen.bat/oxygen.sh oxygenAuthor.bat/oxygenAuthor.sh oxygenDeveloper.bat/oxygenDeveloper.sh syncroSVNClient.bat/syncroSVNClient.sh), you have to add or modify parameters in the java command at the end of the script.
For example, to set the maximum amount of Java memory to 2 GB in Windows, add the -Xmx parameter to the last line of the .bat file like this:
